text: The boxed ad in the opportunities section of the Kardon Journal of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Allied Medical Sciences stood out like a cut diamond in a handful
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of gravel. "Wanted," it read, "Veterinarian--for residency in active
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: livestock operation. Single recent graduate preferred. Quarters and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: service furnished. Well-equipped hospital. Five-year contract, renewal
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: option, starting salary 15,000 cr./annum with periodic increases. State
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: age, school, marital status, and enclose recent tri-di with application.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Address Box V-9, this journal."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Jac Kennon read the box a second time. There must be a catch to it.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Nothing that paid a salary that large could possibly be on the level.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Fifteen thousand a year was top pay even on Beta, and an offer like this
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: for a new graduate was unheard of--unless Kardon was in the middle of an
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: inflation. But Kardon wasn't. The planet's financial status was A-1.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: He knew. He'd checked that immediately after landing. Whatever might
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: be wrong with Kardon, it wasn't her currency. The rate of exchange was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: 1.2-1 Betan.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: A five-year contract--hmm--that would be seventy-five thousand. Figure
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: three thousand a year for living expenses, that would leave sixty-plenty
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of capital to start a clinic. The banks couldn't turn him down if he had
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: that much cash collateral.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon chuckled wryly. He'd better get the job before he started
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: spending the money he didn't have. He had 231 credits plus a few
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: halves, tenths, and hundredths, a diploma in veterinary medicine, some
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: textbooks, a few instruments, and a first-class spaceman's ticket. By
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: watching his expenses he had enough money to live here for a month and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: if nothing came of his efforts to find a job on this planet, there was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: always his spaceman's ticket and another world.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Another world! There were over six thousand planets in the Brotherhood
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of Man. At two months per planet, not figuring transit time, it would
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: take more than a thousand Galactic Standard years to visit them all, and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: a man could look forward to scarcely more than five hundred at best. The
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: habitat of Man had become too large. There wasn't time to explore every
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: possibility.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: But a man could have certain standards, and look until he found a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: position that fitted. The trouble was--if the standards were too high
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the jobs were too scarce. Despite the chronic shortage of veterinarians
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: throughout the Brotherhood, there was a peculiar reluctance on the part
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of established practitioners to welcome recent graduates. Most of the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: ads in the professional journals read "State salary desired," which was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: nothing more than economic blackmail--a bald-faced attempt to get as
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: much for as little as possible. Kennon grimaced wryly. He'd be damned if
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: he'd sell his training for six thousand a year. Slave labor, that's what
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: it was. There were a dozen ads like that in the Journal. Well, he'd give
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: them a trial, but he'd ask eight thousand and full GEA benefits. Eight
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: years of school and two more as an intern were worth at least that.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: He pulled the portable voicewrite to a comfortable position in front of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the view wall and began composing another of the series of letters that
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: had begun months ago in time and parsecs away in space. His voice was a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: fluid counterpoint to the soft hum of the machine.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: And as he dictated, his eyes took in the vista through the view
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: wall. Albertsville was a nice town, too young for slums, too new for
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: overpopulation. The white buildings were the color of winter butter in
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the warm yellow sunlight as the city drowsed in the noonday heat. It
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: nestled snugly in the center of a bowl-shaped valley whose surrounding
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: forest clad hills gave mute confirmation to the fact that Kardon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: was still primitive, an unsettled world that had not yet reached the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: explosive stage of population growth that presaged maturity. But that
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: was no disadvantage. In fact, Kennon liked it. Living could be fun on a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: planet like this.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: It was abysmally crude compared to Beta, but the Brotherhood had opened
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kardon less than five hundred years ago, and in such a short time one
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: couldn't expect all the comforts of civilization.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: It required a high population density to supply them, and while Kardon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: was integrated its population was scarcely more than two hundred
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: million. It would be some time yet before this world would achieve a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Class I status. However, a Class II planet had some advantages. What it
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: lacked in conveniences it made up in opportunities and elbow room.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: A normal Betan would have despised this world, but Kennon wasn't normal,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: although to the casual eye he was a typical representative of the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Medico-Technological Civilization, long legged, fair haired, and short
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: bodied with the typical Betan squint that left his eyes mere slits
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: behind thick lashes and heavy brows. The difference was internal rather
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: than external.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Possibly it was due to the fact that his father was the commander of a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Shortliner and most of his formative years had been spent in space. To
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon, accustomed to the timeless horror of hyper space, all planets
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: were good, broad open places where a man could breathe unfiltered air
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: and look for miles across distances unbroken by dually bulk heads and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: safety shields. On a planet there were spaciousness and freedom and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: after the claustrophobic confinement of a hyper ship any world was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: paradise. Kennon sighed, finished his letters, and placed them in the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: mail chute. Perhaps, this time, there would be a favorable reply.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon was startled by the speed with which his letters were answered.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Accustomed to the slower pace of Beta he had expected a week would
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: elapse before the first reply, but within twenty-four hours nine of his
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: twelve inquiries were returned. Five expressed the expected "Thank you
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: but I feel that your asking salary is a bit high in view of your lack
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of experience." Three were frankly interested and requested a personal
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: interview. And the last was the letter, outstanding in its quietly
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: ostentatious folder-the reply from Box V-9.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Would Dr. Kennon call at 10 A.M. tomorrow at the offices of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Outworld Enterprises Incorporated and bring this letter and suitable
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: identifications?" Kennon chuckled. Would he? There was no question about
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: it. The address, 200 Central Avenue, was only a few blocks away. In
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: fact, he could see the building from his window, a tall functional block
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of durilium and plastic, soaring above the others on the street, the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: sunlight gleaming off its clean square lines. He eyed it curiously,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: wondering what he would find inside.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: The receptionist took his I.D. and the letter, scanned them briefly,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: and slipped them into one of the message tubes beside her desk. "It will
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: only be a moment, Doctor," she said impersonally. "Would you care to sit
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: down? '"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Thank you," he said. The minute, reflected, could easily be an hour. But
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: she was right. It was only a minute until the message tube clicked
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: and popped a capsule onto the girl's desk. She opened it, and removed
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon's I.D. and a small yellow plastic rectangle. Her eyes widened at
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the sight of the plastic card.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Here you are, Doctor. Take shaft number one. Slip the card into the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: scanner slot and you'll be taken to the correct floor. The offices you
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: want will be at the end of the corridor to the left. You'll find any
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: other data you may need on the card in case you get lost." She looked at
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: him with a curious mixture of surprise and respect as she handed him the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: contents of the message tube.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon murmured an acknowledgment, took the card and his I.D., and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: entered the grav-shaft. There was the usual moment of heaviness as
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the shaft whisked him upward and deposited him in front of a thickly
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: carpeted corridor.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Executive level, Kennon thought as he followed the receptionist's
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: directions. No wonder she had looked respectful. But what was he doing
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: here? The employment of a veterinarian wasn't important enough to demand
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the attention of a senior executive. The personnel section could handle
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the details of his application as well as not. He shrugged. Perhaps
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: veterinarians were more important on Kardon. He didn't know a thing
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: about this world's customs.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: He opened the unmarked door at the end of the corridor, entered a small
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: reception room, smiled uncertainly at the woman behind the desk, and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: received an answering smile in return.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Come right in, Dr. Kennon. Mr. Alexander is waiting for you.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander! The entrepreneur himself! Why? Numb with surprise Kennon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: watched the woman open the intercom on her desk.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Sir, Dr. Kennon is here," she said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Bring him in," a smooth voice replied from the speaker. Alexander X. M.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander, President of Outworld Enterprises--a lean, dark, wolfish man
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: in his early sixties--eyed Kennon with a flat predatory intentness that
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: was oddly disquieting. His stare combined the analytical inspection
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of the pathologist, the probing curiosity of the psychiatrist, and the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: weighing appraisal of the butcher. Kennon's thoughts about Alexander's
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: youth vanished that instant. Those eyes belonged to a leader on the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: battlefield of galactic business.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon felt the conditioned respect for authority surge through him in
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: a smothering wave. Grimly he fought it down, knowing it was a sign of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: weakness that would do him no good in the interview which lay ahead.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "So you're Kennon," Alexander said. His lingua franca was clean and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: accentless. "I expected someone older."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Frankly, sir, so did I," Kennon replied.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander smiled, an oddly pleasant smile that transformed the hard
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: straight lines in his face into friendly curves. "Business, Dr. Kennon,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: is not the sole property of age."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Nor is a veterinary degree," Kennon replied.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "True. But one thinks of a Betan as someone ancient and sedate."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Ours is an old planet--but we still have new generations."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "A fact most of us outsiders find hard to believe," Alexander said. "I
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: picture your world as an ironclad society crystallized by age and custom
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: into something rigid and in flexible."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You would be wrong to do so," Kennon said. "Even though we are cultural
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: introverts there is plenty of dynamism within our society."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "How is it that you happen to be out here on the edge of civilization?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I never said I was like my society," Kennon grinned. "Actually I
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: suppose I'm one of the proverbial bad apples."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "There's more to it than that," Alexander said. "Your early years
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: probably influenced you."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon looked sharply at the entrepreneur. How much did the man really
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: know about him? "I suppose so," he said indifferently.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander looked pleased. "But even with your childhood experiences
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: there must be an atavistic streak in you--a throwback to your
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: adventurous Earth forebears who settled your world?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon shrugged. "Perhaps you're right. I really don't know. Actually,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: I've never thought about it. It merely seemed to me that an undeveloped
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: world offered more opportunity."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "It does," Alexander said. "But it also offers more work. If you're
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: figuring that you can get along on the minimum physical effort required
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: on the Central Worlds, you have a shock coming."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I'm not that innocent," Kennon said. "But I am not so stupid that I
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: can't apply modifications of Betan techniques to worlds as new as this."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander chuckled. "I like you," he said suddenly. "Here read this and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: see if you'd care to work for me." He picked a contract form from one of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the piles of paper on his desk and handed it to Kennon. "This is one
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of our standard work contracts. Take it back to your hotel and check it
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: over. I'll expect to see you at this time tomorrow."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Why waste time?" Kennon said. "The rapid-reading technique originated
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: on Beta. I can tell you in fifteen minutes."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Hmm. Certainly. Read it here if you wish. I like to get things
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: settled--the sooner the better. Sit down, young man and read. You can
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: rouse me when you're finished." He turned his attention to the papers on
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: his desk and within seconds was completely oblivious of Kennon, his face
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: set in the rapt trancelike expression of a trained rapid reader.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon watched for a moment as sheets of paper passed through
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander's hands to be added to the pile at the opposite end of the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: desk. The man would do better, he thought, if he would have his staff
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: transcribe the papers to microfilm that could be read through an
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: shrugged and seated himself in the chair beside the desk. The quiet was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: after page with mechanical regularity.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Finally Kennon turned the last page, paused, blinked, and performed
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the necessary mental gymnastics to orient his time sense. Alexander, he
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: noticed, was still engrossed, sunk in his autohypnotic trance. Kennon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: waited until he had finished the legal folder which he was reading and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: then gently intruded upon Alexander's concentration.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander looked up blankly and then went through the same mental
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: gyrations Kennon had performed a few minutes before. His eyes focused
title: The Lani People

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Thirty--years?"

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Good Lord Lister! I'd have guessed her at least three hundred!"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Wrong life scale. Lani only live about one tenth as long as we do.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: They're mature at twelve and dead at fifty."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: live to be a hundred."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: them." Alexander's face darkened at an unpleasant memory. "So we don't
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: He had owned a Varl once and had delighted in its almost human
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: intelligence. But the Varl weren't human and there lay their tragedy.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Two thousand years of human domination had left them completely
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: its explosive acquisitive nature, and none with its drive to conquer,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: colonize, and rule. And probably it never would.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: The little Varl were one race among hundreds that had fallen before the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: fierceness and the greed of men. But unlike most others, the Varl were
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: be a threat. Not only were they essentially gentle and noncombative, but
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Your pipeline's still working, I see," Alexander said. "Yes, this is

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: here for better than four centuries, and we're still doing all right.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: was similarity, the Lani were probably not human.

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: It had been as full a day as he had ever spent filled with changes

text: so abrupt that they were exhausting. He felt confused. There were no

text: test.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: But the Brotherhood of Man was based upon it. The feeling of unity that
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: pervaded mankind's expanding empire was its product. From almost the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: must help each other or perish. The spirit of co-operation against the
title: The Lani People

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: rivalries on Earth. Men--all men--were brothers in arms.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: And so the Brotherhood was born--and the concept born of necessity
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: authority that men would accept. Yet basically it was not a government.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: It was an attitude of mind. Men accepted its decisions as they would
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: accept the rulings of a family council, and for the same reasons.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: The Brotherhood laid down certain rules but it did not attempt to
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: enforce them. After all, it didn't need to. It also arbitrated disputes,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: against dangerous enemies. And that was all. Yet in its sphere the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: authority of the Brotherhood was absolute.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: There was only one criterion for membership in the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Brotherhood--membership in the human race. No matter how decadent or
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: primitive a population might be, if it was human it was automatically
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: eligible for Brotherhood--a free and equal partner in the society of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: human worlds.
title: The Lani People

text: Kennon doubted that any nonhuman race had ever entered the select circle
