title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: desk. "Mind if I ask you some questions, Doctor?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: that form."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That will be attended to," Brainard said grimly.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But how did you deduce she wasn't from a Betan colony?" Kennon asked.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But this business of her being fifteen years old! That's impossible.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: She has the development of a woman of twenty-five."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Of course--oh--I see! It could be something like that.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: twenty-year intervals--there was a marked physical precocity."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Hmm--I see. Yes, it's possible. On Alpha V the colonists grew from
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: infancy to maturity in fifteen years."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "And wasn't Heaven one of our early colonies?"

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Yes--it was established after the Great Schism near the end of the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: world. We packed the whole lot of them off to a world of their own where

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: they could develop as they pleased. They called it Heaven--odd name for
title: The Lani People

text: a fogworld--but there's no accounting for tastes." Brainard chuckled.

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: history is pretty weak."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Betan ancestry providing your theory and the facts coincide."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: sighed. "You have brought us a great deal of trouble, Kennon. You are

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I don't believe it is really his fault," Kennon said slowly. "I don't
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: think he has ever known the truth."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Why didn't you tell him?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "The answer to that should be obvious. Even though I trusted him

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: completely, I could never be sure. He has a Free Trader background
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: and those people can't he trusted where money's concerned. The whole
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kardonian culture is an outgrowth of Free Traderism: small business,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: independent corporation, linear trusts, and all the cutthroat

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: competition such a culture would naturally have. It's a regular jungle

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of Free Enterprise. I couldn't predict how he would react. He could
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: either act in a moral manner and make restitution, or he could quietly
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: cut our throats and go on with his business."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I see. The temptation to cut a throat might be overwhelming."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "They fight commercial wars," Kennon said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Disgusting--utterly uncivilized! Under the circumstances you had no
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: other course. Still, they have no moral right to enslave human beings."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "There is always the element of doubt. Maybe they didn't know. After
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: all, an impartial court declared the Lani alien--and the Betan mutation
title: The Lani People

text: isn't known throughout the Brotherhood."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "One doesn't go around broadcasting data on the variations of one's germ

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: plasm," Brainard said. "That's a private affair--a matter of personal
title: The Lani People

text: privacy."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Brainard nodded. "We're no more courageous than any other civilization.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: alone."

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That's the trouble," Kennon said. "We're all content to leave things

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: alone. If I hadn't found the spaceship I'd not have been able to lay

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Alexander's employment mnemonic erasure would have removed all memory of

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: wouldn't have been the wiser course. Naturally, once I knew, I couldn't
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: do anything else than what I did."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Naturally," Brainard said. "Humanity reaches the heights when it faces
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: questions of moral responsibility."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "To mankind," Kennon added heavily. "We have a convenient blind spot
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: regarding our moral responsibility to other intelligent races."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "A harsh fact, but true--and who is to judge whether it is right or
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: wrong? We achieved dominance of Earth by our moral responsibility to
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: all mankind. We learned that after the Exodus. As for the other
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: races--perhaps someday we will learn moral responsibility for all

text: intelligence--but we are not ready for that yet. That's too big a mental
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: hurdle." Brainard sighed. "We are what we are, and we change slowly. But
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: we change."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "True enough," Kennon said. "But it's hard to be philosophical about
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: it."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You're young. Live a couple of centuries and you will understand
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: patience."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon smiled.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You know," Brainard said thoughtfully, "you still have plenty of things
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: to do."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I know. I'll have to make a transcript of this discussion, have
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: it witnessed, and make a sealed record. I have to arrange for the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: reposition of the evidence inside the Egg, and a complete recording of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the Egg itself."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "And to be safe you'll need several facsimiles, properly attested. The
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: arms of these outworld entrepreneurs are long, and unfortunately not all
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Betans are models of honesty."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I'd better get started then."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Let me help you," Brainard said. "I have a little influence in this
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: area--and your cause interests me." He picked up the phone on his desk.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: CHAPTER XIX
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "What are you going to do with that girl?" Brainard asked.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Formalize our mating as soon as she is able to get out of bed," Kennon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: replied.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "She is an ignorant, untrained savage!" Brainard protested. "You should
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: hear the stories the nurses tell about her!"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon chuckled. "You don't have to tell me about those. I've lived with
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Lani for two years. But she's not stupid."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "What are your plans?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "After we establish her humanity legally," Kennon said, "I'm going to
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: send her to school."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "For twenty years?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "If necessary. But I don't think it will take that long. She has some
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: schooling."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But no training--and what of the Lani in the meantime?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I have plans for that. I'm going back to Kardon and give Alexander a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: chance to make restitution. I think he is an honorable man. Slavery may
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: be as revolting to him as it is to any civilized human. He deserves a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: chance to rectify his grandfather's error."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That is reasonable--and in the best traditions of the Brotherhood."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Furthermore, it's practical," Kennon said. "Alexander is the only one
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: fully qualified to handle the problems of enfranchisement. He's known
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the Lani all his life, and he is an executive type. A Brotherhood
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: committee would probably botch the whole affair. What with colonial
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: jurisdiction, territorial rights, and all the legal quibbling that
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: committees love, the Lani would get a poor deal. And there's no reason
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: to wreck the lives of a couple of hundred million Kardonians because
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: the rightful owners of Kardon were illegally enslaved. That happened
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: too long ago to have any practical meaning. There are other and better
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: solutions."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "What?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "How should I know?" Kennon asked. "But I'm sure Alexander will. That's
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: his field."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "All you have to worry about is whether he'll co-operate," Brainard
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "He'll co-operate once he knows the score," Kennon said confidently.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "And he'll have to make some form of restitution. But it shouldn't
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: involve Kardon. Actually the Lani were never in a position to develop
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: that world. They'd probably have remained on Flora indefinitely. The old
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: court records showed no tendency for their culture to expand. They
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: were an inbred group, a static, balanced society in harmony with their
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: environment. In nearly thirty-five hundred years their numbers increased
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: only to a few thousand. Actually there is a good possibility that the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: race would ultimately have died out if Old Alexander hadn't enslaved
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: them and instituted a controlled breeding program. There are more Lani
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: alive today than there were at the height of their power. So in a way
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Old Alexander did them a favor. He kept their race alive. All we can
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: expect is a fair and just settlement."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But if Alexander doesn't co-operate?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That's where you come in. You'll be a watchdog. If you don't receive
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: annual progress reports from me--and see or talk to me personally every
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: second year, you are released from our bond and can do what you wish
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: with the evidence I've accumulated."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "We'd better get this into Private Record," Brainard said. "We can
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: transcribe an agreement and place it in the Public Repository."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "A good idea and we'd better waste no time. Alexander might still be
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: looking for me--and if he is, it's merely a question of time before he
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: catches up."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Ten years have passed. It's doubtful. But we could keep you here at the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Center."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon shook his head. "Too dangerous. And besides it would compromise
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: you. No--we'll get everything possible done to make the Lani's case
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: airtight, and then I'll return to Kardon. It will put our case in
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: a better light if it ever comes to trial, if I go back voluntarily.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Anyway--I'm morally bound to return. Now let's make this record."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "It's your decision," Brainard said. "And it's your neck--but I must
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: admit that I agree with you."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I'll feel safer when we get the legal details clarified," Kennon said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "And what of the girl?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Can you take care of her if I have to leave quickly?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Of course. I'll give her personal attention, and after she has her
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: child I'll see that she is sent to you."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That's decent of you, Doctor."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "It's my moral responsibility," Brainard said as he slipped a new tape
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: into the recorder.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Copper responded quickly to rest and therapy. The space shock cleared up
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: quickly. The gerontological treatments put her to bed again, but within
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: a month she was completely normal, and her lifespan was now that of a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: normal human. She could look forward to some four hundred years with
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon--and the prospect was not unpleasant. The Center fascinated her.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Never before had she seen a hospital devoted to the care and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: treatment of humans. It was a far cry, in its polished steel and stone
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: magnificence, from the tiny primitive structure over which Kennon had
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: presided. Yet both places served the same purpose. Perhaps Kennon was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: right--that there was no difference between man and Lani. The idea was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: not nearly as unbelievable as it was at first.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I never realized what it meant to be human," Copper said as she held
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon's hand. "It is nice to feel important and to know that our child
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: is a member of the race that rules the galaxy."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "So you're convinced?" Kennon chuckled.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "The serological identity--" she began.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Hmm. You've been getting some education, I see."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Well," Copper smiled, "I didn't think you wanted a stupid woman. I can
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: read--and since you are around so seldom nowadays, there is little else
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: to do. I've been reading history, medicine, and novels," she finished
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: proudly.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "A fine catholic selection," Kennon said, "Now if you add mathematics,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: sociology, and philosophy you'll have a well-rounded basic education."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Dr. Brainard has been trying something he calls 'hypno.' He says it
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: will help me learn faster. But I can't see that it's done much good."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You won't until you need the information," Kennon said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That technique is only good for implanting basic knowledge, and much of
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: that will merely supplement or complete that which you already have. You
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: won't be conscious of it."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Oh--I think I see what you mean."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Of course, you'll have to continue your formal education. There's a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: great deal for you to learn. It should keep you busy while I'm away."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Away? Where are you going?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Back to Kardon."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But you can't! Alexander will destroy you."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I think not. After all, ten years have elapsed since we left there and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: he's had plenty of time to think. Douglas must have told him about us.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: I wouldn't be surprised if he has already done something about your
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: people."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: She shivered. "He might--but the question is what would he do? He could
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: have killed them all!"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon shook his head. "I don't think so. He never struck me as a mass
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: murderer."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: She shook her head. "You don't know the Alexanders like I do. I was
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: raised by them. They're capable of anything. But what is this business
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: of ten years? That's silly. I haven't had my child yet--and it doesn't
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: take ten years of pregnancy to produce a baby."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "It's the difference between subjective and objective time," Kennon
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: said. "We traveled here through hyperspace--low Cth--in an uncompensated
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: ship, and there is little temporal flow in the levels below the blue."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Oh--of course."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon chuckled. "That would have been Greek to you a couple of weeks
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: ago. See where that basic data fits?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "But I've always known that."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You just think you have. Search your memory and see if I'm not right."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Copper shook her head. "It's very strange," she said. "But that's not
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: important. This idea of going back to Kardon, though--that's a different
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: thing--that is important."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I have to do it. Not only because it's a personal moral obligation but
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: also because of the Lani. They must have their freedom."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Providing there are any still alive."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Stop being a calamity howler. Whatever Alexander may be, he's not a
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: butcher. He even loved a Lani once. You told me so yourself. And he
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: couldn't kill where he loved."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: She nodded. "I suppose you're right, but I've never lost my fear of the
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Man Alexander. He held the power of life and death over me. But if you
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: must go then I should go too. My obligation is greater than yours."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Later," Kennon said. "You're not ready to return. It will be time
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: enough after you have learned some civilized habits."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Copper's face lengthened. "You mean like wrapping myself in cloth like
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: these people do?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "That's part of it."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Why can't they be sensible--or are they so ashamed of what the gods
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: gave them that they must hide themselves?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "No, it's not that. At least not exactly. It's custom. And you must
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: learn to conform to customs--outwardly at least--no matter what you may
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: really think."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Isn't that a form of lying?" Copper asked.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I suppose so."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Isn't that strange. Your society exalts truth, honor, morality, and
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: intelligence--yet you lie about your attitude."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "It's called diplomacy," Kennon said. "It's part of respect for others'
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: attitudes and beliefs, a necessary part of human relationships."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Then you'd be a nudist on Santos?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Of course--even though I think it isn't proper, I couldn't inflict my
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: ideas and attitudes on the customs of an independent world."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Oh--you think I'm doing that?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Yes--and it is a mark of barbarism."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Sometimes you're not very nice," Copper said.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: Kennon smiled wryly. "I suppose I'm not," he agreed.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I'll try to be civilized," Copper said. "But if you go to Kardon--I'm
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: going with you."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Perhaps," Kennon said. "We'll see how things turn out."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You don't want me to go with you?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "To be honest--no," Kennon said. "You're safe here, and until your
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: status is cleared by a Brotherhood court, I wouldn't care to place you
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: in Alexander's hands. And clearing your status is going to take time."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You mean that I am still his property?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Yes. But there is a legal doubt that will prevent him from exercising
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: his claim as long as you stay on Beta. In the area where he has power,
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: that doubt might not hold. So until your status is definitely proven to
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: be human, you should not leave."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "And what happens if this court denies my claim?"
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Then we appeal to the Council. However, with the evidence we have, your
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: claim cannot reasonably be denied. The only question is one of time. It
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: may take years. Still, I don't think there is anything to worry about. I
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: don't think Alexander will give us any trouble, but there's no sense in
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: taking chances."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "You still think I'm a Lani," she said accusingly.
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I do not."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "Then you think that I'd obey Alexander, after what I did to Douglas."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I can only repeat that Douglas isn't the Boss-man."
title: The Lani People
author: Bone, Jesse F. (Jesse Franklin)

text: "I wish I knew what you really thought."
title: The Lani People
